This is necessary not merely because of the heavy expenditure that is involved in thevarious programmes but also because of their effects on priceswages, etc. The review must take into account also thecivil needs of the population, including the needs of industryand commerce.It is not proposed to make any change in the activities and responsibilities of existing Committees which areconcerned with various aspects of the building problem^ unless there is any development In theiaposition which makes this necessary. Sir Connop Guthrie has accepted the PrimeMinister's invitation to undertake the continuous reviewdecided upon.
